title: The truth about Jack Goodhue's 'flying mullet'? It really might make him faster
text:
No major sporting competition is complete without wacky hairdos. The Romanian national football team's bleached-blond, boyband look (all 11 players) was as iconic in the 1998 World Cup as Zinedine Zidane's performance in the final. Four years later, Brazilian Ronaldo leaving a small patch of forehead hair unshaven was unfathomably bizarre – and a defining moment of the tournament.

Rugby has never been short of a dodgy barnet, and this World Cup has fully lived up to expectation. Joe Marler's mohawk is a good example – but perhaps nothing is as eye-catching as the hairdo sported by a marauding New Zealand centre.

Jack Goodhue, who is named in the Kiwi XV for this Saturday's semi-final clash...
description: No major sporting competition is complete without wacky hairdos.
